results.title: Therapeutic Delivery of Simvastatin Loaded in PLA-PEG Polymersomes Resulted in Amplification of Anti-inflammatory Effects in Activated Microglia.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@), a @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-lowering drug has been studied in chronic @DISEASE_Neuroinflammatory_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D000090862 @@@neuroinflammation@@@ associated with @<m>DISEASE_Heredodegenerative_Disorders_Nervous_System</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020271 @@@degenerative brain disorders@@@ due to its potential protective properties against @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ reaction, oxidative damage, @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@neuronal dysfunction@@@, and death.

citations.NLM: Manickavasagam D, Novak K, Oyewumi MO. Therapeutic Delivery of Simvastatin Loaded in PLA-PEG Polymersomes Resulted in Amplification of Anti-inflammatory Effects in Activated Microglia. AAPS J. 2017 Dec 14;20(1):18. PMID: 29243172

results.title: Simvastatin therapy in adolescent mice attenuates HFD-induced depression-like behavior by reducing hippocampal neuroinflammation.
results.text_hl: Emerging studies indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SMV@@@, decreasing @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ levels) has therapeutic effects on @<m>DISEASE_Heredodegenerative_Disorders_Nervous_System</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020271 @@@neurological and neuropsychiatric diseases@@@ through hippocampal-dependent function.

citations.NLM: Wu H, Lv W, Pan Q, Kalavagunta PK, Liu Q, Qin G, Cai M, Zhou L, Wang T, Xia Z, Shang J. Simvastatin therapy in adolescent mice attenuates HFD-induced depression-like behavior by reducing hippocampal neuroinflammation. J Affect Disord. 2019 Jan 15;243():83-95. PMID: 30236762

results.title: Simvastatin reverses the downregulation of M1/4 receptor binding in 6-hydroxydopamine-induced parkinsonian rats: the association with improvements in long-term memory.
results.text_hl: These results provide a possible mechanism for @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment in @<m>DISEASE_Heredodegenerative_Disorders_Nervous_System</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020271 @@@psycho-neurological diseases@@@ such as @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D010300 @@@PD@@@ via M1/4 receptors.

citations.NLM: Wang Q, Wei X, Gao H, Li J, Liao J, Liu X, Qin B, Yu Y, Deng C, Tang B, Huang XF. Simvastatin reverses the downregulation of M1/4 receptor binding in 6-hydroxydopamine-induced parkinsonian rats: the association with improvements in long-term memory.
